definition[0]: an advantage or profit that you get as a result of doing something
example[0]: With electric cars there is a big environmental payoff.
definition[1]: a payment that is made to someone, often illegally, in order to stop them from causing you trouble
example[1]: Union leaders allegedly received huge payoffs from the company’s bosses.
definition[2]: a payment made to someone when they are forced to leave their job
example[2]: The average payoff to staff was about £2000.
definition[3]: a good result from a particular plan, project etc
example[3]: The company’s biggest payoff came in May when it made $18.4 million.
example[4]: This low-risk strategy promises a payoff regardless of what the stockmarket does.
definition[4]: a payment made to someone in order to stop them causing trouble
example[5]: The company refused tomake thepayoff and complained to the authorities.
